intro: Endiandra frondosa, commonly known as the broad-leafed endiandra, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by fleshy, colorful fruits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
